pages.text: Falcatus is a symmoriid cartilaginous fish from the Carboniferous period which has displayed sexual dimorphism. The males had a long spiny structure on top of its head whereas the females lacked this spine. They were relatively small and and the males were larger than the females.
$(l)Eats:$() Raw/Cooked Fish$(br)$(l)Breeds with:$() Raw Fish$(br)$(l)Egg Type:$() Drops Egg$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Bucket
